info.title: com-quicko-gsp
info.description:
## üëã Introduction

Welcome to the Quicko GSP API documentation. Here you'll find all information to start communicating and exchanging data with the GST Network via Quicko GSP.

## üöÄ Getting Started

#### **Environments and Endpoints**

We have two environments and their URLs are as below.

| **Environment** | **Host URL** |
| --- | --- |
| UAT | uat-api.gsp.quicko.com |
| PROD (Live) | api.gsp.quicko.com |

#### Authorization

Once you are onboard with Quicko GSP, we will provision you two pairs of API Key and API Secret, one for each environment. These credentials are to be used to generate an access token using which API requests can be sent to Quicko GSP.

## üåê Ecosystem

Quicko GSP supports the GST Network Ecosystem, through which you can access the GST Public and Taxpayer APIs.

#### GSTN Ecosystem

The GSTN maintains a developer portal where you'll be able to find the documentation for GST APIs.

To connect to the GSTN via Quicko GSP, you have to put the Quicko GSP host URL in the endpoint on the GSTN Dev Portal.

For e.g., in the below endpoint, you need to replace the {domain-name} with Quicko GSP host URL.

Endpoint on GSTN Dev Portal - https://**{domain-name}**/taxpayerapi/v3.0/returns/gstr1

Endpoint to be called - https://**api.gsp.quicko.com**/taxpayerapi/v3.0/returns/gstr1

post.description: Authenticate using your x-api-key and x-api-secret. On success, you'll receive an access_token and refresh_token.
Use this API to refresh your access_token using the refresh_token provided earlier.

get.description: Validate a GSTIN and fetch basic taxpayer details from the GST system.
Track status of returns filed by a taxpayer for a given financial year.

parameters.name: ip-usr
parameters.description: Public IP Address of end user who requested access to data

parameters.name: txn
parameters.description: Unique Transaction ID associated with the request

parameters.name: state-cd
parameters.description: State code to which the Tax Payer belongs to, e.g. 11 for Sikkim

post.description: Trigger OTP to the taxpayer‚Äôs registered email and mobile linked to the GST portal.

get.description: Used to generate OTP for electronic verification code (EVC) filing, applicable to returns like GSTR-1, GSTR-3B and so on.

parameters.description: Optional. From which time taxpayer want Invoices. E.g. 04-02-2017

parameters.name: ip-usr
parameters.description: Public IP Address of end user who requested access to data

parameters.name: txn
parameters.description: Unique Transaction ID associated with the request

get.description: Check the filing status and reference ID of a previously submitted return.
Fetch the list of IRNs generated for a taxpayer for a specific return period.
Fetch the Input Tax Credit ledger to check ITC balances, credits claimed, and availability for a GSTIN.
